attributes.gcd: Refers to the unique code of the accounting standard or the rules to which accountants adhere when preparing financial statements to ensure minimum level of consistency. E.g. GAAP, IFRS etc. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, GAAP. GAAP are the rules to which accountants adhere when preparing financial statements to ensure minimum level of consistency. The Generally Accepted Accounting Principles exist to ensure that accountants are using the same or almost the same standards so that comparison of financial statements between or within a company is easy and accurate. They also promote transparency in accounting. However, GAAP provides broad guidelines, there is room for companies to follow an approach within a guideline.
Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.
Refers to the central counterparty code which clears the transaction.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.

Refers to the amount required under the agreement to be contributed to the default fund of a CCP legal entity. This amount, if positive, must be reported for all CCPs including those with which the respondent has no active trades.
Refers to the margin amount utilized with the central counterparty to cover the delivery costs for the trade. This is a part of the variation margin.
Refers to the margin amount utilized with the central counterparty for an exposure taken on the exchange. This is a part of the variation margin.

ISO currency codes is a standard published by the International Organization for Standardization 4217, which delineates currency designators and country codes, alpha and numeric. This column will capture the standardized currency code. Currency dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.

ISO currency codes is a standard published by the International Organization for Standardization 4217, which delineates currency designators and country codes, alpha and numeric. This column will capture the standardized currency code. Currency dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.
Refers to the initial margin amount which is kept with the CCP and utilized.
Refers to the entity code of the legal entity to which the account will be attributed in the general ledger.

attributes.logicalName: Net Buy Premium Margin Utilized Amount
attributes.gcd: Refers to the margin amount utilized with the central counterparty when a buy position is taken for an option contract on the exchange. This is a part of the variation margin.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
Refers to the run identifier for a set of Records participating in the particular Run with the Run Execution identifier. This is a combination of Run Main Identifier and Run Execution Identifier.
